result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. OTTE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Methamphetamine (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Use only one doctor and only one pharmacist unless approved by the agent.

timeConds.notes: on count 3, under the Huber Law including child care.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason L. OTTE
Current: 524 North 5th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2021)
Prior: 1021 S. 20th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States
It is hereby ordered the above named defendant is terminated from Drug Court effective immediately.

01:48 PM Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by ZOOM video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason L. OTTE appeared in custody, by ZOOM video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  Court goes over Defendant's right to an attorney.  Defendant waives his right to an attorney and wishes to proceed to a hearing without an attorney today.  Defendant has had an opportunity to review the motion for termination and is not contesting the violations.  State supports its motion.  The Court finds that the Defendant violated the terms of his agreement with the Manitowoc County Drug Court and terminates the Defendant from the program.  State to prepare Order for Termination for Court's signature.

Participant was not clean and sober.  Admitted to past use and being dishonest.   Relapsed this week.  Court discusses sanctioning him.  Attend the lighthouse 1 hour each day.  Must put a puzzle together and while doing so, he will need to ask another in recovery for help; advice.  When the puzzle is completed, he should present it to the Court, along with who he reached out to and what he learned from the experience.  Working on finding a balance in his personal life.  Paperwork in order.

Clean and Sober.  Coin.  Things are going well.  Spending time in the community with his peers.  Working on his 40.  Is being released from house limitations so that he can meet the necessary 40.  Court reminds participant of the importance of boundaries.  Working on community service requirements.  Paperwork in order.


  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:05 AM  Participant has been clean and sober.  Things are going well.  Spent time with another participant.  Short on 40, journaling is good.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2020 at 09:00 am.

9:19AM  Participant reports via ZOOM conference.  Just recently released from custody.  Not clean and sober.  Coin.  Court tells participant how important it is to set boundaries that are healthy.  He is assessing what put him in the difficult situation that led up to the relapse and will work with the team to understand better.  Court encourages participant to focus on himself and his treatment first, and to continue working hard toward a positive outcome.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:24 AM  Participant attends VIA Zoom conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  Submitted phase application.  Team approved.  Advancing to Phase 2.  Overall, things are going well. 09:06 AM  Participant attended VIA Zoom conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin. Reports that things are going well.  Working on building family relationships.  Working on getting driver's license.  In grace period since he was enrolled during pandemic.  Is working to find hours.   Planner in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:09 AM  Participant attends via ZOOM conference.  Clean and Sober.  Coin.  Last week went really well.  Spent time with family.  Had a positive experience rebuilding bonds.  Paperwork in good shape.  Court encourages him to make it a goal to journal each day.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:02 AM  Participant attends via Zoom conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  Things are going great.  Spent time outdoors over the holiday.  Re-establishing his family relationships.  Paperwork in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:04 AM   Participant attends via ZOOM conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  Spent time with Judge Rohrer fishing.  Making positive progress in treatment.  Things are going well overall.  Paperwork in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:17 AM  Participant attends VIA ZOOM conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  Doing well, continued progress on himself.  He learned from his relapse, and has been working on the accountability aspect that comes with that.  Court reminds him that how he has dealt with it since then shows positive progress.  Has been removed from limitation rules.  Paperwork in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:10 AM  Participant attends VIA Zoom conference.  Not clean and sober.  Coin.  Self reported.  Placed on limitation rules until further notice.  Paperwork in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2020 at 09:00 am.

9:15 AM   Participant attending VIA Zoom conferencing.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  Working on coping in this current situation with the resources available to him.  Court encourages participant to take pride in his accomplishments, and to keep working hard.  Paperwork in decent order.

09:16 AM  Participant attends via Zoom conference.  Clean and sober.  Coin.  - 90 days.  Things are going well.  Working to develop a new normal.  Off of limiting rules at house.  Paperwork is in good shape.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:16 AM  Participant reports VIA ZOOM.  Court informs participant that he is off to a strong start.  Reaching out when needed.  Overall, things are going well.  Paperwork in order.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:08 AM  Participant attends VIA ZOOM conferencing.  Participant presented coin.  Will be introduced to team once we are back in the courtroom.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2020 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to delete the penalty enhancers on counts 1 and 3.   Motion granted.   
Count 1 - Deliver Methamphetamine - Guilty plea.   
Count 3 - Deliver Heroin - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2 and 4.   Motion granted.    Sentencing hearing is set for 01-20-17 at 11:00 a.m.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.

of Intent to Introduce Recorded Communications

Defendant in custody on bench warrant appearing by video from Manitowoc County Jail. Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
